Updated the storm kafka spout code to make it work with Heron. Updates are:
1. remove Kafka bolt and trident related code.
2. change Scheme related interface to accept the byte[] instead of ByteBuffer
3. change the pom.xml file for compiling

Contrib code is put in Heron repo temporarily,  it should be moved to a separate heron-contrib repo finally. Setting up such a repo takes time so currently the code is put here to unblock others.

title: Add more default metrics for Python topology
body:
This patch adds more default metrics for Python topology, namely:

```
'__gateway-sent-metrics-size'
'__gateway-sent-metrics-packets-count'
'__gateway-sent-metrics-count'
'__gateway-sent-exceptions-count'
'__gateway-in-stream-queue-size'
'__gateway-out-stream-queue-size'
'__gateway-in-stream-queue-expected-capacity'
'__gateway-out-stream-queue-expected-capacity'
'__gateway-in-queue-full-count'
```

This PR also adds a half-acking topology example.

related to #1264

title: Refactor HeronExecutor signal handling
body:
Cherry picking refactorings that I made during scaling that can be committed first, since they don't relying on the scaling functionality (but will be needed in some cases). No new functionality here, just moving some things around to clean up before adding new functionality.
1. Refactored how exit signal handling is done. This will help when we introduce a state manager that needs closing.
2. Renamed some public methods (`prepare_launch()` -> `initialize()`, `monitor_process()` -> `start_process_monitor()`)
3. Added synchronization around `processes_to_monitor`. 

Relates to #1292

title: Make system config global (singleton as a module).
body:
This PR makes system config global by putting system configuration into a single module. This corresponds to [what Java instance does](https://github.com/twitter/heron/blob/master/heron/instance/src/java/com/twitter/heron/instance/HeronInstance.java) and we don't need to pass `sys_config` around in different initialization functions.

Related to #1264.
#1309 should go first

title: Clean up executor logging in LocalScheduler
body:
Executor log files in LocalScheduler currently look like this:

```
heron-executor-d7e5809a-started.stderr
heron-executor-dc47dc90-started.stderr
heron-executor-edd18eeb-started.stderr
heron-executor-effb081c-started.stderr
heron-executor.stdout
```

Two issues:
1. Every run of the executor makes a new stderr file which causes file bloat of mostly 0-byte sized files. Each run shares the same stdout file though, which is inconsistent.
2. When running multiple executors, they all log to the same stdout file, which makes the file contents difficult to read.

This changes executor logging to look more like the logging of the other processes. If you have two executors you'd see something like this:

```
heron-executor-0.stderr
heron-executor-0.stdout
heron-executor-1.stderr
heron-executor-1.stdout
```

If one fails and is restarted, it continues to log to the same file as the previous instance.

title: Update Launcher to set PackingPlan in StateManager
body:
Once #1282 ships, which adds `setPackingPlan` and `deletePackingPlan` to `SchedulerStateManagerAdaptor` this patch will pass CI and can then ship. This will cause PackingPlan to be persisted in `StateManager` upon submit.

Once this is shipped, we can update the heron executor to read PackingPlan on startup fron the state manager, then we can get rid of the dreaded instance distribution string.

title: Keep argument value as list
body:
A bug introduced by https://github.com/twitter/heron/pull/1119 takes only the first element of the argument value list and destructively updates the corresponding key argument in the dictionary. See: https://github.com/twitter/heron/pull/1119/files#r74668021

This problem is blocking PyHeron integration test so this is not good. This PR fixed it.

cc: @prabhuinbarajan @taishi8117

title: Allow overriding docker build environment variables
body:
It is possible to build heron in an environment that does not include
the git repository (this can be the case in ci for instance). We should
allow people building override the derived variables to manually set the
version.

title: DO NOT MERGE - scaling topologies working branch
body:
This PR is just to make it easier to view diffs and to have travis ci verify commits. This is a long-lived branch.

No need to review this branch. All reviews will happen on smaller PRs. You might want to unwatch this one to not get tons of commit emails that don't require action.

Working branch for #1292. This branch will be cherry-picked and merged into master piece by piece until it's empty.

title: Improve logging on explorer, tracker, scheduler, etc...
body:
This patch tries its best to unify logging infrastructure and properly propagate verbose level set from command line. Specifically:
1. `color.py` and `log.py` has been merged to `log.py`
2. `tar` with `-v` always prints verbose messages to stderr and `curl` without `-s` always print progress bar to stderr. `runSyncProcess` will always print out stderr from subprocess because we use `SEVERE` level. In this PR, we change to `FINE` level.
3. Bug fix. I didn't review some PRs carefully so that my previous PRs that fixed some logging problems were reverted.
4. Various tiny fixes including word usage, making log look better.

More commits may be pushed later. 

cc: @taishi8117 @maosongfu @kramasamy 

resolves: #1194 #1129

title: Added single-thread Heron Instance in python
body:
`st_heron_instance.py` is an implementation of Heron Instance with single-thread in Python. They server similar functionalities as `HeronInstance`, `Gateway`, `Slave` etc. in Java implementation.

[Changes](https://github.com/twitter/heron/pull/1201/files#diff-3e725585fbf57518c1e7209b1b18e401R13) to `heron_core.bzl` is necessary to include this heron instance to Heron's core package. Please refer to #1195 as well.

This PR depends on #1236

title: DO NOT MERGE: Added pyheron API + basic component for python topology support
body:
This is a working branch and these files are NOT yet ready to be merged; this PR is opened for reviewing purposes. I will need to add unit tests and codes for remaining functionalities, as well as integration tests once other python topology components are ready, before this PR is merged.

These files are Heron Instance's base components (spout/bolt/topology) in Python. Modules included in this PR serve similar functionalities as `BoltInstance`, `SpoutInstance`, API interfaces for Spout and Bolt, `TopologyBuilder` and `HeronSubmitter` etc. in Java implementation. 

Once Python topology is officially supported, these files will be packaged into a library (maybe called `pyheron`) for topology development; they are also made compatible with [StreamParse API](http://streamparse.readthedocs.io/en/v3.0.0/api.html).

title: Modified pex_loader to avoid duplicates in sys.path
body:
Added checks to sys.path for pex_loader to avoid duplicate insertion

With this, you can call pex_loader.load_pex() more than once without worrying about duplicate insert. This is useful when more than one part of the code want to dynamically load the same PEX but you don't know which load_pex() is called first until runtime.

title: refactor the getMaxResource method
body:
As mentioned in #1161, put the getMaxResource refactor into a separate PR.

The new getMaxRequiredResource will find the max requirement for cpu, ram and disk from all the required container resources.

MesosScheduler and AuroraScheduler will use the new method to decide their resource allocation to each container.

title: Don't keep STDIN open if not attached
body:
The `-i` argument for docker keeps STDIN open even when the container is
not attached. In some ci environments this will likely by the case and
result in this error: `cannot enable tty mode on non tty input`

This also changes the scratch and output directory creation to use `-p`
so it will both create the whole path and not fail if the directory
exists.

repo.name: incubator-heron
repo.description: Apache Heron (Incubating) is a realtime, distributed, fault-tolerant stream processing engine from Twitter

title: Run docker compilation without pseudo-tty
body:
In order to run the artifact compilation in docker in a ci environment
we need to run without allocating a pseudo-tty or the compilation will
fail to run the container with `cannot enable tty mode on non tty input`

This will require people to do `docker ps` and then `docker kill $containerid` to actually stop mid-run if they want to. An alternative approach here could be to include a flag or an environmental variable to switch off the psuedo-tty in CI environments.
